quest.name: Lord of the Inferno
journal: Minfilia would like you to assist the Immortal Flames.

In a bid to learn the whereabouts of the abductees, the Immortal Flames have devised a plan to capture Amalj'aa, using the false priest Ungust as bait. Minfilia bids you take part in the operation as the Scions' representative. Head for Camp Drybone and assemble with the Flames.

You have been briefed on the details of the operation. The Flames anticipate that the Amalj'aa will offer fierce resistance, and you are urged to prepare accordingly. When you are ready, proceed to the Invisible City, and lie in wait at the designated location.

Mere moments after surrounding the enemy, you learn that there is a traitor in the ranks, and are swiftly subdued. After an indeterminate amount of time, you awake to find yourself imprisoned within an Amalj'aa stronghold, along with the Flames. Speak with them to ascertain the situation.

It appears the Amalj'aa mean to make an offering of you and your companions to their primal, Ifrit. If it must end, let it be with weapon in hand. Wait for the right moment, and strike back at the beastmen.

※Challenge the Bowl of Embers with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the trial's entrance point.

It would appear that Ifrit has the power to bind mortals to his will, but for reasons yet unknown you are immune to his influence. Having failed to make you his minion, Ifrit elects to exterminate you instead, only to find himself outmatched. Quite how you found the strength to resist the godlike being is a question for another time. For now, make your way back to Camp Drybone, and speak with Thancred.
Having lavished you with praise, Thancred takes his leave to return to the Waking Sands. Minfilia will be eager to hear back from you as well. Report to her at the earliest opportunity.

At the Waking Sands, Minfilia and Thancred take turns bombarding you with information, explaining to you how the crystal robbery and the abductions served to advance Ifrit's cause. Thancred then reveals a disturbing truth: in order to prevent the primal from gaining strength, his “tempered” victims must be put to death. Though this revelation casts a grim shadow over your victory, you find yourself more determined than ever to play your part as a Scion.
objectives: Report to the flame sergeant at Camp Drybone.
Lie in wait at the Invisible City.
Confront Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers.
Speak with Thancred at Camp Drybone.
Report to the Scion of the Seventh Dawn at the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Word has arrived from Thancred concerning our ongoing investigation.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It appears he was able to extract some information from our friend Ungust, the false priest.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: He revealed that he is due to meet with the Amalj'aa to discuss their dealings.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Immortal Flames believe that the meeting will present an ideal opportunity to ambush and capture the Amalj'aa responsible for the abductions, and so they mean to have Ungust attend as planned.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As the Amalj'aa are anticipated to offer fierce resistance, the Immortal Flames have requested our support.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I would have you provide it to them, Forename. Thancred is presently attending to another matter, but will join you as soon as he is able. Until such time as he does, you will be the Scions' sole representative on the ground.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Before he left, he bade me tell you to “save some for him.” Such is his confidence in you─a confidence I share.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When you have made ready, pray take yourself to Camp Drybone and report to the flame sergeant leading the mission. May you walk in the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Ah, you're Forename Surname of the Scions? My thanks for coming, friend. We're stronger for your assistance.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Allow me to brief you on our mission. Our objective is to capture Amalj'aa and prise from them the whereabouts of the abductees.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: The lizardmen aren't aware that their man, Ungust, has been exposed. When they come to the rendezvous point to meet the traitor, we'll spring the trap.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Owing to the clandestine nature of the mission, we can deploy only a small contingent. Every member must count, and so we requested the aid of the Scions.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: The rendezvous will take place at the Invisible City. Please make your way there and lie in wait.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: We stand to learn much and more of the Amalj'aa plot if the mission succeeds, Forename. Let's make sure it does.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: We stand to learn much and more of the Amalj'aa plot if the mission succeeds, Forename. Let's make sure it does.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Lord of the Inferno”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Is the bait in place?

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Our man is in position, sir.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Good. We make our move as soon as the Amalj'aa appear.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Yes, sir!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Uwaaah!

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text: What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Wait. Something's amiss...

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Hee hee hee...

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: Ahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: I'm afraid your little ambush ends here!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)I eluded the Immortal Flames' clutches for moons before finally being caught. Did you not wonder how I managed it?

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: 'Twas almost as if someone was feedin' him information from the inside! Gahahaha!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Aye, your every movement was known to me ahead of time! Hee hee hee!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Now, as much as I'd love to chat awhile, I have appointments to keep.

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: They're all yours!

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: Put up your weapon, or your comrade's a dead man!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Behind you!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Bring herhim.

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: The rest of you, march!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Traitorous scum...

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: I fear the Amalj'aa mean to give us to their god as an offering. If I must die, then let me die a soldier's death─with steel in hand!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: The lizardmen marched us to their stronghold.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: They're preparing for something...and I for one do not want to be around when they finish.

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Damn it all... A traitor in the Flames! What has become of us...?

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: I'm sorry you were dragged into this. Were I a better judge of character, we wouldn't be in this mess...

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE2
dialogue.text: They're going to kill us, aren't they!? Gods, I don't want to die! I want to go home! <sob>

dialogue.name: AMALJA
dialogue.text: Rejoice, heathens, for your worthless lives shall soon have meaning!

dialogue.name: ADALA
dialogue.text: <gasp> You mean to go and rescue our comrades!?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Rescue her comrades?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You are about to be transported to the battle area for the quest “Lord of the Inferno.” This is a provisional measure for phase 3 of the beta test.\Beta 3 only

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the battle area?\Beta 3 only

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes\Beta 3 only

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No\Beta 3 only

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text:
(-Amalj'aa Zealots-)Lord of the Inferno, hearken to our plea!
Lord of the Inferno, deliver us from our misery!

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: O mighty Ifrit, Lord of the Inferno!

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: Your humble servants beseech You! Grace us with Your divine presence!

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: O mighty Ifrit! We bring before You ignorant savages who know not Your godhead!

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: If it please You, Lord, scorch their heathen souls with Your cleansing flame, and mark them as Your own!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: B-Bloody hells...

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text: Bring those two as well!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Unnngh...

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: Wh-What's going on!? Th-This ain't what we agreed!

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text: None but servants of Lord Ifrit may behold the rite of summoning. The souls of unbelievers are forfeit!

dialogue.name: TRAFFICKER
dialogue.text: (-Ungust-)Nooo! Spare me, I beg you!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Pitiful children of man! By my breath I claim you!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Arise once more as my loyal minions! Feed my flames with your faith, and all who stand against us shall burn!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: O mighty Ifrit...

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: My one true god...

dialogue.name: FLAMETRAITOR
dialogue.text: Your words are my bread...

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: Impossible! By what sorcery do you resist my master's will!?

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: Could it be...?

dialogue.name: TEMUGGZOH
dialogue.text: Your soul already belongs to another!? Yes, that is the only explanation!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Forsooth, thy frail mortal frame can serve as vessel to the blessing of but One.

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Yet I smell not the taint of another upon thee...

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: The truth of thine allegiance waxeth clear─thou art of the godless blessed's number.

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: The Paragons warned of thine abhorrent kind. Thine existence is not to be suffered.

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: My flames shall consume thy flesh and soul both!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Succumb to the Inferno!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Surrender thyself to the fires of judgment!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Thy soul shall burn for all eternity!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Thou art strong, mortal!

dialogue.name: IFRIT
dialogue.text: Such energies have I spent...yet the blessing of Light shieldeth thee still...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Pray forgive my lateness!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I was delayed by a congregation of Amalj'aa zealots. I swear, each seemed more evangelical than the last.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hmph! Persistent lot!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Phew...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see the Bloodsworn wasted no time extracting the captives. No less than I'd expect from the Flame General's handpicked men.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As for those two...it is fair to say their hardships have only just begun. They have much to answer for.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I feel I owe you an apology, Forename. Had I known this mission would prove so dangerous, I would never have left you to face it alone. You have been given a veritable baptism of fire.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But let us continue this conversation in more agreeable surrounds. Camp Drybone, shall we say?

dialogue.name: FLAMESOLDIER
dialogue.text: This way, sir!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: So that was the mighty Ifrit...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: And what a disappointment he was. The readings are nowhere near what I had anticipated, even taking Ul'dahn interference into account.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)You should know better than to rely upon five-year-old data left by the VIIth Legion.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Nor can we expect any form of support from the motherland, given the troubles at court. We have only ourselves to rely upon.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Ever the pessimist, my dear Livia. Promise me you'll never change.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: We've wasted enough time here. That meter of yours is too old to give any reading worth a damn.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Not that there was aught worth a damn for it to read...but I take your point. I suppose we must content ourselves with the knowledge that we've achieved our primary objective.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Yet I find that I am troubled by that adventurer's unexpected show of strength. Could such a foe prove a hindrance to our plans?

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Perhaps─but that is a consideration for another time.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: You have been given a task. That is your priority. I suggest you treat it as such.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Fail to do as my lord commands...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: ...And I will spare him the trouble of punishing you.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: With allies like that...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Beware a woman in love. I shall need to be on my best behavior.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are, Forename. Come, rest awhile─you will have no better opportunity. After witnessing their god's ignominious defeat, the Amalj'aa will be less inclined to risk our wrath─for a time, at least.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now, where were we? Ah yes, I was in the process of apologizing. I do hope you can forgive me. I arrived too late to be of any use...to you or the abductees.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: They may be whole of body, but the same cannot be said of their minds. For once a man is tempered...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, but it ill suits me to dwell on the negatives. Amidst all our misfortunes, there is still reason to rejoice. Ifrit is slain, and by your hand, no less!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That is the deed of no ordinary individual, Forename. Not that I ever thought you were ordinary. On the contrary, I have long suspected that you have the potential to shape the fate of this realm. What can I say? My fine eye for talent remains undimmed.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Minfilia will be proud beyond all reckoning when she hears of your deeds. I trust you shan't object to my bearing the tidings to her. That way I can claim to have contributed something to this mission.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You, meanwhile, have earned yourself a rest. Take some time to relax, and return to the Waking Sands when you are good and ready. We can discuss matters in more detail then. Just don't take too long, will you? The realm's problems won't solve themselves.

dialogue.name: GUIDE
dialogue.text: Ah, the triumphant hero returns!

dialogue.name: GUIDE
dialogue.text: Thancred told us the news upon his arrival. He is presently in the solar, giving a full report to Lady Minfilia.

dialogue.name: GUIDE
dialogue.text: You should join them at once. Lady Minfilia is most eager to see you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...My late arrival nearly cost Forename herhis life. I wasn't there when the Amalj'aa took herhim prisoner...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And I wasn't there when they served herhim to Ifrit...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yes, by some miracle, shehe survived─but that does not excuse the fact that shehe should never have had to face such dangers alone. I failed herhim utterly.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Just as I'm failing you all...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: What's done is done, Thancred. You can ill blame yourself for every─

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forename! It is so good to see you again!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Impeccable timing, my friend. I had just finished regaling Minfilia with your heroic exploits.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred has told me everything. You have done well to return to us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The perils you faced were undeniably great, yet a part of me believes that I had no cause to fear. And now we can put paid to our long investigation.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As we suspected, the Amalj'aa undertook both the robbery and the abductions with the aim of summoning their primal, Ifrit.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Nor is this tale limited to Ul'dah. Similar incidents have been rife in both Limsa Lominsa and Gridania of late.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I daresay you've been curious as to how these crimes are linked to the primals. Permit me to explain.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Having manifested in the physical realm, primals must consume aether if they are to maintain their presence here. And the stronger they become, the more aether they require.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now, aether exists throughout creation. It flows through all life, and permeates the very air that we breathe.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Alas, this alone will not suffice to sustain the likes of Ifrit. Nay, he and his kind require a more concentrated source of aether─crystals.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is for this reason that incidents involving crystals can often be traced back to a primal.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Which leaves us with the why of the abductions. To understand this, you must first understand how primals are born.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: When all is well with the world, primals possess no physical form. Their essence is dispersed across the great river of aether.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: However, when the world is plunged into chaos, those who worship the primals cry out to their gods for deliverance from suffering.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: These cries serve as a beacon toward which a primal's essence is irresistibly drawn. It is this coming together─or “aetheric coalescence”─which grants the beings physical form.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Once born, a primal gains strength from its followers' worship. The more numerous and fervent they are, the more powerful their god becomes.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But the primals are seldom satisfied with such reverence as their adherents freely give, and in order to gain more power, they do not scruple to create followers. They do this by “tempering” mortals─a process to which you yourself were subjected.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet even as Ifrit took your comrades in his thrall, you alone remained unaffected. This is thanks to the power you possess─the Echo.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We know not the why of it, but those blessed with the Echo are immune to primal influence.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is as though a greater power protects us...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When first you came to us, I told you that the Echo would be instrumental in dealing with the primal threat. I trust you now begin to see why.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The recent incidents all share a common trait: meticulous planning. Such elaborate designs are a new development, and one which fills me with an unshakable sense of foreboding.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: While I share your concern, my presiding feeling is one of relief at your safe return.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ah, the Immortal Flames assured me that they will deal with the aftermath, so you need not concern yourself with that. We may rest easy for a time.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I suggest you take full advantage of the respite, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You may be sure it won't last long. Once the people learn the identity of the hero who felled Ifrit, I fear you will have nary a moment to yourself!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Whether she intended to or no, Minfilia neglected to tell you something─something I think it would be best you heard from one of us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It concerns the tempered abductees that were rescued... I am sorry to report that all are to be put to death, the Flames with whom you were imprisoned included. Needless to say, this information must not be made known to the public.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I swear to you that we would not do this if there were any other recourse─but once a man is tempered, he is tempered for life. His very existence lends strength to the primal whom he cannot choose but worship.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And so we Scions continue our fight, that no more innocents need be sacrificed. I hope that you will continue to stand with us, Forename.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But I should be going. I must offer my apologies to the Flame General for the losses his people suffered. Till next time!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gods forgive me... How many more lives...? Louisoix would never have allowed this to happen.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I have to do better... I have to be stronger...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hee hee! Our Amalj'aa friends will keep you company!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Filthy traitors! When I get my hands on you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hee hee! How long will you last, I wonder!?

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Another wave! Stay sharp, men!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, is there no end to them!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hee hee! The show is only just beginning!

dialogue.name: THM
dialogue.text: N-Not here...not like this...

dialogue.name: PGL
dialogue.text: Arrrgh!

dialogue.name: GLA
dialogue.text: Tell my daughter...I love her...

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: We mustn't give up!

dialogue.name: FLAMESGT
dialogue.text: Gods have mercy...
